Executive Summary
The rapid rise of short-form video platforms like Instagram and TikTok has transformed the way
creators engage their audiences. For many the process of transforming long talking-head
chunks.full_text:
Executive Summary
The rapid rise of short-form video platforms like Instagram and TikTok has transformed the way
creators engage their audiences. For many the process of transforming long talking-head content
into engaging reels remains manual time intensive and inconsistent. Moolya proposes an AI-driven
SaaS platform that automates this process end-to-end from ingesting raw talking-head videos
analyzing stylistic references transcribing speech creating captions inserting B-roll and exporting
optimized reels. The system is designed to align with user-defined style profiles ensuring each
output reflects the creator’s unique identity while maintaining professional consistency. The solution
will be developed as a cloud-native scalable SaaS platform with GPU-accelerated processing
pipelines modular architecture and role-based access. The initial build will focus on an MVP that
produces Instagram-ready reels with optional enhancements in later phases.

Cross-Platform Healthcare App
Challenge:
Ensuring functional consistency across Android, iOS, and Web for 200,000+
expectant and new parents while delivering a sensitive, emotionally positive user
experience.
Approach:
Automated 85% of regression testing across 50+ devices and OS versions.

Focused on sentiment-driven features such as pregnancy tracker, polls, and
healing mode.

Validated admin panel and advertiser workflows for accurate targeting.
Impact:
35% faster release cycles through automation.

25% increase in app ratings (boosted positive reviews).

15% higher ad click-through rates, improving advertiser ROI.

chunks.full_text:
Case Study 1
Leading Life Sciences Data Management Platform
About the Platform
A cloud-based life sciences data management platform built for global pharmaceutical enterprises to
streamline multi-country clinical operations. The platform centralizes data collection, regulatory tracking,
and analytics across study sites.
Test Value Delivered
End-to-End Test Automation: Developed 420+ automated test scripts across API, UI, and backend layers,
increasing regression coverage by 65% and reducing manual effort by 45% per release.
Compliance-Driven Validation: Designed 180+ test scenarios aligned with 21 CFR Part 11, HIPAA, and
GxP frameworks, ensuring audit readiness and traceability.
Performance and Data Accuracy Testing: Simulated concurrent user loads up to 10,000 sessions to
validate system stability under production-scale volumes.
Business Impact
Faster Release Turnaround: Achieved 40% reduction in release validation time, enabling biweekly
release cycles instead of monthly.
Improved Data Confidence: Ensured 99.8% data accuracy in system-to-system synchronization during
validation cycles.
Simplified Compliance Audits: Reduced audit preparation time from 3 weeks to 5 business days,
supported by automated validation documentation.

About the Platform
A digital clinical trial management platform built to help CROs and pharma sponsors manage multi-phase
studies, real-t
chunks.full_text:
Case Study 2
Clinical Trial Automation and Monitoring Platform
About the Platform
A digital clinical trial management platform built to help CROs and pharma sponsors manage multi-phase
studies, real-time site monitoring, and patient safety reporting across multiple geographies.
Test Value Delivered
Automated Regression and Validation: Implemented automation covering 14 core modules and 75
business-critical workflows, achieving 70% automation coverage in under 8 weeks.
Integration Testing Across Ecosystem: Verified seamless interoperability among EDC, CTMS, and Safety
systems using mock and live API environments 4 ensuring 100% data consistency across integrations.
Risk-Based Testing Approach: Adopted a hybrid validation model prioritizing high-risk modules,
optimizing QA effort by 35% without reducing test depth.
Business Impact
Accelerated UAT Sign-offs: Reduced UAT cycle time from 12 days to 7 days, improving overall release
cadence.
Zero Critical Defects in Production: Achieved a defect leakage rate below 0.3% post-release.
Enhanced Sponsor Confidence: Helped the client secure three additional clinical partnerships through
improved platform reliability and audit readiness.

chunks.full_text:
Project Overview
Dimagi is seeking to establish a Test Automation Solution for one of its key product lines –
CommCare Connect across web and mobile which currently has no automation in place. Primary
focus areas are: Assess Automation Feasibility. Design and implement a robust Test Automation
Framework. CI/CD Integration. Define an automation roadmap covering functional, regression, and
smoke testing. Enable the internal QA team to maintain and scale automation effectively over time.

chunks.text_preview:
Objective
The objective of this proposal is to establish a strategic QA partnership between Dimagi and Moolya
Software Testing to ensure comprehensive quality ownership and implement a robust test
aut
chunks.full_text:
Objective
The objective of this proposal is to establish a strategic QA partnership between Dimagi and Moolya
Software Testing to ensure comprehensive quality ownership and implement a robust test
automation solution. Moolya will leverage its expertise in test automation and quality engineering to
enhance product stability, improve testing efficiency, and minimize manual testing efforts. The
engagement will focus on: Establish a scalable automation framework for both web and mobile
platforms. Ensure CI/CD readiness through integration with build pipelines. Reduce manual effort
by automating test flows. Deliver measurable outcomes in terms of test coverage, execution
efficiency, and release confidence. Build automation competency within Dimagi’s QA team through
knowledge transfer and enablement sessions.

chunks.text_preview:
Testing Scope
Design and implement a scalable automation framework for Dimagi’s CommCare Connect product
covering both Web and Mobile platforms. Collaborate with Dimagi team to prioritize modules and
chunks.full_text:
Testing Scope
Design and implement a scalable automation framework for Dimagi’s CommCare Connect product
covering both Web and Mobile platforms. Collaborate with Dimagi team to prioritize modules and
features. Develop a Test Automation Roadmap defining smoke, feature, and regression test packs,
with provisions for future expansion. Integrate automation with CI/CD pipelines to enable
continuous testing. Implement best practices for framework optimization and long-term
sustainability. Define and track key automation metrics to measure effectiveness. Upskill the Dimagi
QA team to independently maintain, enhance, and scale automation efforts.

chunks.full_text:
Project Overview
Dimagi seeks to optimize its QA automation suite to achieve higher efficiency, reduce maintenance
effort, and improve the scalability of its testing framework. Moolya, with its strong expertise in
automation strategy and framework design, proposes to act as Dimagi’s strategic partner to assess,
optimize, and future-proof the existing automation setup. This engagement will focus on:
Comprehensive audit of the existing framework and test scripts. Recommending best practices and
design improvements. Sharing documentation and training the QA team for sustained success.
Moolya’s automation-first approach will ensure that Dimagi achieves faster release cycles, more
stable automation suites, and a lower long-term cost of quality.

chunks.full_text:
Problem Statement
Dimagi’s current automation framework has grown organically and now faces challenges with:
Redundant, flaky, or hard-to-maintain tests. Increased maintenance effort and reduced scalability.
Lack of alignment with future QA strategy and CI/CD needs. Without intervention, automation
effectiveness may decrease over time, impacting release velocity and reliability.

Executive Summary
The rapid rise of short-form video platforms like Instagram and TikTok has transformed the way
creators engage their audiences. For many the process of transforming long talking-head
chunks.full_text:
Executive Summary
The rapid rise of short-form video platforms like Instagram and TikTok has transformed the way
creators engage their audiences. For many the process of transforming long talking-head content
into engaging reels remains manual time intensive and inconsistent. Moolya proposes an AI-driven
SaaS platform that automates this process end-to-end from ingesting raw talking-head videos
analyzing stylistic references transcribing speech creating captions inserting B-roll and exporting
optimized reels. The system is designed to align with user-defined style profiles ensuring each
output reflects the creator’s unique identity while maintaining professional consistency. The solution
will be developed as a cloud-native scalable SaaS platform with GPU-accelerated processing
pipelines modular architecture and role-based access. The initial build will focus on an MVP that
produces Instagram-ready reels with optional enhancements in later phases.

Nira Balance by Breathe Again is a data-driven wellness platform that uses real-time health
insights, smart device integration, and expert guidance to prevent and reverse lifestyle diseases.
Backed by scientific evidence, it delivers personalized nutrition, fitness, and lifestyle plans,
empowering users to achieve measurable health outcomes, improved energy, and long-term
balance. Moolya aims to be a strategic QA partner in this journey of Breathe Again by taking
complete ownership of QA through a collaborative and structured approach to testing. We believe
in a true partnership model, where Moolya integrates seamlessly with Breathe Again teams,
contributing proactively at every stage rather than operating as an external vendor.

approach, practices, or processes in place. Existing system stability must be preserved changes
should not disrupt current functionality. Large feature set with high business value demands robust
validation. Need for a collaborative partner who can integrate seamlessly with the internal team
rather than operate as an external vendor.

Executive Summary
Keysight Technologies empowers innovators to design and deliver next-generation solutions with
precision, speed, and confidence. Moolya proposes a DevOps Implementation and Managed
Operations solution to strengthen Keysight’s software delivery ecosystem through a self-managed
Kubernetes platform on AWS, integrated with your existing toolchain Jenkins, Polaris, Black Duck,
and Vault. Together, we’ll enable Keysight to deliver faster, operate securely, and scale seamlessly,
supporting your vision of engineering excellence. This initiative will: Accelerate deployment cycles
through automated CI/CD and secure pipelines. Enhance governance and compliance via Polaris
and Black Duck integration. Ensure continuous reliability with Vault-based secrets, ACM
certificates, and AWS observability.

chunks.full_text:
Executive Summary
Benow platform enables offline digital payments and affordability solutions for merchants selling
mobile phones and CDIT products. The platform collaborates with leading OEMs and banks to
provide offers such as Full Swipe Cashback, No Cost EMI, Low Cost EMI, and Customer Interest
Bearing (CIB) schemes.
Benow would like to partner with Moolya to conduct a Disaster Recovery (DR) Readiness Testing to
ensure seamless business continuity by validating its DR environment as a failover for its primary
infrastructure.

chunks.text_preview:
Problem Statement
Benow’s current DR setup is designed to handle failover scenarios between its Mumbai (active) and
Hyderabad (DR) regions, but the readiness and reliability of the DR environment have
chunks.full_text:
Problem Statement
Benow’s current DR setup is designed to handle failover scenarios between its Mumbai (active) and
Hyderabad (DR) regions, but the readiness and reliability of the DR environment have not been fully
validated from an independent QA perspective.
The key risks include:
(cid:127) Potential downtime or transaction disruption during failover.
(cid:127) Limited validation of critical transaction flows post-switch.

chunks.full_text:
Title: Dimagi_CommCare_Connect_Test_Automation
Description: PRIMARY_ENTITY: Dimagi

DOCUMENT_TYPE: proposal

COVERAGE: complete

SUMMARY: This document is a test automation proposal for Dimagi's CommCare Connect product, submitted by Moolya. It outlines the establishment of a robust test automation solution across web and mobile platforms, focusing on enhancing product stability and reducing manual testing efforts through a strategic QA partnership.

USE_WHEN: Questions about Dimagi's test automation approach

EXAMPLE_QUESTIONS: 
- What is the test automation strategy proposed for Dimagi's CommCare Connect?
- How will Moolya enhance the QA capabilities for Dimagi?
- What are the deliverables in the test automation proposal for Dimagi?

TOOLS_AND_TECHNOLOGIES:
- CI/CD: Integration with build pipelines to enable continuous testing.
- Automation Framework: A scalable framework designed for both web and mobile testing.
- Bugasura: Test management and issue tracking tool mentioned for managing test cases and bugs.

SCOPE: The document covers the design and implementation of a test automation framework, CI/CD integration, development of test scripts, and knowledge transfer to Dimagi's QA team.

ENUMERATED_SCOPE:
- Assess Automation Feasibility.
- Design and implement a robust Test Automation Framework.
- CI/CD Integration.
- Define an automation roadmap covering functional, regression, and smoke testing.
- Enable the internal QA team to maintain and scale automation effectively over time.
- Collaborate with Dimagi team to prioritize modules and features.
- Develop a Test Automation Roadmap defining smoke, feature, and regression test packs, with provisions for future expansion.
- Implement best practices for framework optimization and long-term sustainability.
- Define and track key automation metrics to measure effectiveness.
- Upskill the Dimagi QA team to independently maintain, enhance, and scale automation efforts.
- Discovery Feasibility & Framework Design.
- Test Automation Setup.
- Pilot Automation.
- Automation Framework Optimization.
- Knowledge Transfer and Handover.

KEY_ENTITIES:
- CommCare Connect
- Test Automation Framework
- CI/CD Integration
- Smoke Testing
- Regression Testing
- Functional Testing
- Automation Roadmap

CONTAINS_LISTS: true

LIST_TOPICS: testing phases, deliverables, automation framework components

TIMELINE:
- Month 1: Discovery of the CommCare Connect application, assessment of existing systems, design and implementation of the automation framework, and development of smoke test scripts.
- Month 2: Continued automation execution, optimization of the automation framework, integration with CI/CD, and knowledge transfer to the QA team.

KEYWORDS: Test Automation, CI/CD, Quality Assurance, Automation Framework, Regression Testing, Smoke Testing, Functional Testing, Test Coverage, Defect Detection, Automation Metrics, Knowledge Transfer, Moolya, Dimagi, Software Testing, Continuous Testing, Testing Efficiency.
Category: proposals
DocType: proposal
Type: pdf

SUMMARY: This document is a test automation proposal for Dimagi, aimed at optimizing their QA automation suite to enhance efficiency, reduce maintenance efforts, and improve scalability. Moolya proposes to conduct a comprehensive audit of the existing framework and provide recommendations for improvements, along with training for the QA team.

USE_WHEN: Questions about Dimagi's QA automation strategy and framework optimization.

EXAMPLE_QUESTIONS: 
- How can Dimagi improve its QA automation framework?
- What are the recommendations for optimizing test scripts at Dimagi?
- What training will be provided to Dimagi's QA team?

TOOLS_AND_TECHNOLOGIES:
- CI/CD: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment integration for automation framework.
- Automation Audit Report: A document summarizing the findings from the audit of the existing automation framework.
- POM (Page Object Model): A design pattern for creating object repositories for web UI elements to enhance test maintainability.

SCOPE: The document covers the audit and optimization of Dimagi's existing automation framework, including recommendations for improvements, documentation, and training for the QA team.

ENUMERATED_SCOPE:
- Comprehensive audit of the existing framework and test scripts.
- Recommending best practices and design improvements.
- Sharing documentation and training the QA team for sustained success.
- Review framework architecture, CI/CD integration, and test coverage.

Title: Proven Casestudies
Description: PRIMARY_ENTITY: Moolya Testing

COVERAGE: complete

SUMMARY: This document presents a series of case studies by Moolya Testing, showcasing their expertise in functional testing, test automation, performance testing, and user experience optimization within the eCommerce domain. Each case study details the challenges faced, the approaches taken, and the business impacts achieved for various clients.

USE_WHEN: Questions about Moolya Testing's case studies in eCommerce testing solutions

EXAMPLE_QUESTIONS: 
- What were the results of Moolya Testing's functional testing for an e-commerce company?
- How did Moolya optimize test automation for financial services?
- What improvements did Moolya achieve in user experience for an e-commerce client?

TOOLS_AND_TECHNOLOGIES:
- Appium: Used for mobile test automation on Android and iOS, achieving 98% test coverage.
- Selenium: Part of the automation framework for web application testing.
- Kafka: Utilized for message processing and capacity testing in performance testing scenarios.

SCOPE: The document covers multiple case studies that highlight Moolya Testing's methodologies and results in various testing domains, specifically focusing on eCommerce solutions.

ENUMERATED_SCOPE:
- Case Study 1: Comprehensive Functional Testing for a Leading E-commerce and Digital Marketing Company
- Problem Statement: Significant daily orders faced issues, impacting operations; Users experienced checkout errors, leading to high cart abandonment rates.
- Approach: Audited application architecture, workflows, order processing, checkout, dependencies; Audited architecture, tested 250+ scenarios, monitored 1.2M+ API calls daily; Monitored 1.2 million+ API calls daily, analyzing response times, failures, and inconsistencies with payment gateways; Simulated 10,000 concurrent users to enhance stability and resolved 95% of data inconsistencies.
- Business Impact: Checkout success rate improved by 85%, increasing transactions by 15%; Optimized order processing speed by 40%, ensuring 98% on-time deliveries; Lowered cart abandonment to 42%, improving conversions and customer retention.
- Case Study 2: Transforming Financial Services Through Test Automation
- Problem Statement: Regression testing covered 5,000+ cases per release, ensuring quality; Automation framework processed 250 test cases hourly, needs optimization.
- Approach: Developed a scalable automation framework, reducing test execution time by 45%; Implemented Appium for Android and iOS, achieving 98% test coverage; Integrated automation into CI/CD, enabling real-time feedback within 15 minutes; Trained 20+ engineers in Java, Selenium, and Appium, enhancing automation efficiency.
- Business Impact: Accelerated release cycles by 30%, improving time-to-market; Enabled execution of 10,000+ test cases daily, supporting scalability; Enhanced software reliability, ensuring seamless user experience.
- Case Study 3: Performance Testing for a Leading Customer Communication Solutions Provider
- Problem Statement: Optimized resources for 1M+ concurrent users without interruptions; Assessed system scalability, ensuring 99.99% uptime under peak loads.

- Problem Statement: High cart abandonment, resulting in a low cart-to-checkout conversion rate; Identified areas for optimization in system processes and product features.
- Approach: Assessed system workflows and optimized key touchpoints for a seamless user journey; Evaluated perfect order experience guidelines across 500+ product categories; Leveraged data analytics to refine user journeys, analyzing 1M+ interactions; Reviewed 100,000+ customer reviews across Play Store and App Store for insights.
- Business Impact: Reduced cart abandonment by 35%, increasing checkout conversions; Enhanced user experience, leading to a 25% rise in repeat purchases.

11.title: Proven Casestudies
11.description:
PRIMARY_ENTITY: Moolya Testing

DOCUMENT_TYPE: case_studies

COVERAGE: complete

SUMMARY: This document presents a series of case studies by Moolya Testing, showcasing their expertise in functional testing, test automation, performance testing, and user experience optimization within the eCommerce domain. Each case study details the challenges faced, the approaches taken, and the business impacts achieved for various clients.

USE_WHEN: Questions about Moolya Testing's case studies in eCommerce testing solutions

EXAMPLE_QUESTIONS: 
- What were the results of Moolya Testing's functional testing for an e-commerce company?
- How did Moolya optimize test automation for financial services?
- What improvements did Moolya achieve in user experience for an e-commerce client?

TOOLS_AND_TECHNOLOGIES:
- Appium: Used for mobile test automation on Android and iOS, achieving 98% test coverage.
- Selenium: Part of the automation framework for web application testing.
- Kafka: Utilized for message processing and capacity testing in performance testing scenarios.

SCOPE: The document covers multiple case studies that highlight Moolya Testing's methodologies and results in various testing domains, specifically focusing on eCommerce solutions.

ENUMERATED_SCOPE:
- Case Study 1: Comprehensive Functional Testing for a Leading E-commerce and Digital Marketing Company
- Problem Statement: Significant daily orders faced issues, impacting operations; Users experienced checkout errors, leading to high cart abandonment rates.
- Approach: Audited application architecture, workflows, order processing, checkout, dependencies; Audited architecture, tested 250+ scenarios, monitored 1.2M+ API calls daily; Monitored 1.2 million+ API calls daily, analyzing response times, failures, and inconsistencies with payment gateways; Simulated 10,000 concurrent users to enhance stability and resolved 95% of data inconsistencies.
- Business Impact: Checkout success rate improved by 85%, increasing transactions by 15%; Optimized order processing speed by 40%, ensuring 98% on-time deliveries; Lowered cart abandonment to 42%, improving conversions and customer retention.
- Case Study 2: Transforming Financial Services Through Test Automation
- Problem Statement: Regression testing covered 5,000+ cases per release, ensuring quality; Automation framework processed 250 test cases hourly, needs optimization.
- Approach: Developed a scalable automation framework, reducing test execution time by 45%; Implemented Appium for Android and iOS, achieving 98% test coverage; Integrated automation into CI/CD, enabling real-time feedback within 15 minutes; Trained 20+ engineers in Java, Selenium, and Appium, enhancing automation efficiency.
- Business Impact: Accelerated release cycles by 30%, improving time-to-market; Enabled execution of 10,000+ test cases daily, supporting scalability; Enhanced software reliability, ensuring seamless user experience.
- Case Study 3: Performance Testing for a Leading Customer Communication Solutions Provider
- Problem Statement: Optimized resources for 1M+ concurrent users without interruptions; Assessed system scalability, ensuring 99.99% uptime under peak loads.
- Approach: Microservice Capacity Testing: Validated performance of 50+ microservices, ensuring efficient load distribution; Auto Scaling Validation: Optimized scaling mechanisms, allowing instant response to traffic spikes; Kafka Message Capacity Testing: Verified smooth processing of 500,000+ messages per second; End-to-End SLA Measurement: Ensured response times under 200ms across all services.
- Business Impact: Kafka processed 2B+ messages daily for seamless communication; Webhook APIs handled 10x traffic, enhancing real-time interactions; Peak stability improved 60%, boosting growth and scalability.
- Case Study 4: Driving User Experience Engagement for a Leading E-commerce Company in India
- Problem Statement: High cart abandonment, resulting in a low cart-to-checkout conversion rate; Identified areas for optimization in system processes and product features.
- Approach: Assessed system workflows and optimized key touchpoints for a seamless user journey; Evaluated perfect order experience guidelines across 500+ product categories; Leveraged data analytics to refine user journeys, analyzing 1M+ interactions; Reviewed 100,000+ customer reviews across Play Store and App Store for insights.
- Business Impact: Reduced cart abandonment by 35%, increasing checkout conversions; Enhanced user experience, leading to a 25% rise in repeat purchases.

KEY_ENTITIES:
- Functional Testing
